channel.title: Using BMP
channel.description:
when i take a screen shot, put it in my editor, and then try to get the b/g black, is there a quick way to do it, where a lot of the pixels are different colors, it would take forever :( i was going to make an auto login, but i didnt want to take all the time to do that, so i just quit.
also,i tried to make the auto-login with DTM but the way the runescape.com's main page is set up, everything is the same :P

item.title: Using BMP
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“KyleGut3, post:5, topic:4130”]instead of taking big screenshots as bitmaps, crop your bmp to only a couple of distinct pixels, i.e. part of the word existing etc.

that way you dont have to bother with black, and your bmp isnt HUGE[/quote]
Yeah! That’s what I do when I make my scripts. Working on a huge one right now with many bmps.

Read full topic

item.title: Using BMP
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

instead of taking big screenshots as bitmaps, crop your bmp to only a couple of distinct pixels, i.e. part of the word existing etc.

that way you dont have to bother with black, and your bmp isnt HUGE

Read full topic

item.title: Using BMP
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Well, it works perfectly for me.
And you’re banned right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Using BMP
item.dc:creator: @doomsday doomsday
item.description:
@doomsday wrote:

No, no no.

Aftermath, stop trying to help, your messing them up.

What you want to do is this, take the paint brush and make it really big, then do as much as you can wihtout touching what you want to stay. Then make your paintbrush smaller, so you can do the rest, also i find it easier to zoom in when doing the blacking, also make sure you crop it before you start blacking it(make it as small as possible so there is less work then need)

You must make it black, especially if your doing it for runescape, since the colors change).

Read full topic

item.title: Using BMP
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Don’t bother making the background black.

It works perfectly otherwise. The only point of making things black is so that they are ignored because scar ignores black pixels.

Read full topic
